name: Through The Würmtal
description: The Würm, 35km long, is not only a river between the Lake Starnberg and the river Amper but is also an eponym for the last major glacial period in the Alpine forelands: The Würm glacial period ended around 10.000 years ago and left behind the Lake Starnberg, the lake Ammer (Ammersee) and the wild and romantic Würmtal (the Würm valley).
